tweet: Through @EndPlasticWaste, companies are investing more than $1.5 billion to help eliminate unmanaged plastic waste in the environment: https://endplasticwaste.org/

Plastics provide many benefits including reducing food waste, improving energy efficiency & reducing material usage, and improving functionality, all at a lower cost. Industry is now focusing is on effective recycling solutions that retain the value of plastic.

Boven of @downewsroom: Innovation in advanced recycling is important to the US manufacturing sector and has the potential to positively address many of the challenges facing this country including maintaining technology leadership and promoting global competitiveness.
Tim Boven of @downewsroom explains a #circulareconomy – one that redesigns, recycles, reuses, and remanufactures to keep materials in their highest value use for as long as possible.

R&T RM @repjimbaird: My home state of Indiana has the highest concentration of plastics industry workers in the country, producing nearly $20 billion in shipments. https://republicans-science.house.gov/legislation/hearings/subcommittee-research-technology-hearing-closing-loop-emerging-technologies …

R&T RM @repjimbaird: We have an opportunity to leverage our expertise to develop a new circular economy for the United States—an economy that produces, recycles, and reuses materials to reduce cost and waste. READ full statement: https://republicans-science.house.gov/news/opening-statements/opening-statement-ranking-member-jim-baird-rt-subcommittee-hearing-emerging …

The plastics industry is one of the largest manufacturing sectors in the United States with more than $430 billion in shipments and 989,000 jobs in 2017. Watch our hearing on emerging recycling tech:  https://republicans-science.house.gov/legislation/hearings/subcommittee-research-technology-hearing-closing-loop-emerging-technologies …

The President’s budget request prioritizes funding at NIST in three new areas that are critical to national security and the economy, including the National Quantum Initiative, #microelectronics, and #ai.

Walter Copan of @usnistgov @commercegov says the FY20 budget prioritizes investments in #ai, #quantum science, advanced manufacturing, microelectronics, & 5G while maintaining NIST’s core measurements science, standards, and technology development

.@usnistgov plays a critical role in protecting our nation’s #cybersecurity and critical infrastructure, including leading the development of a national Privacy Framework to help government and private organizations manage privacy risks.

Don’t know much about NIST? It’s one of the nation’s oldest physical science labs & everything from GPS to electronic health records and nanomaterials to computer chips rely on @usnistgov tech, measurements & standards  https://www.nist.gov/about-nist  pic.twitter.com/agpR5bzrH5

The current @NASA request calls for more than $21 billion while the previous Administration proposed just under $20 billion for FY20.  This Administration has added over a billion dollars to NASA’s budget request & that’s before Congress appropriates final funding.

The President’s FY20 budget request included $21.5 billion for NASA. Although this is a decrease  from the amount appropriated in FY19, the Trump Administration has consistently proposed increased funding for NASA & Congress has appropriated even more than requested pic.twitter.com/L3Wr0BQwDA
